author: A_Brickset_user
title: Whats the problem?
review:
I purchased this set from a discontinued line and i was quite satisfided:

PLUS:
*Some nice pieces
*Nice minifigs (if you havent got them)
*If you get more than 3 and some guards (included in more modern sets) than you can make that great scene from Ruturn Of The Jedi

MINUS
*No guards or Lando
*A bit underscale although so is every Lego set
*Luke has a Padawan Obi-Wan Kenobi face

author: A_Brickset_user
title: This set should have been released 4 years later to coincide w/jabba's palace
review: Yes.  We all know that the real Desert Skiff had lando, guards, and was bigger than this, and that Luke is too abundant in the SW range, but come on, people!  This set has just-unfrozen HAN!!  When you combine it with the 2003 jabba's palace sets, it really starts to shine, and you can fully re-create the Tatooine scene from ROTJ.  That said, the vehicle is a little half-baked looking. I added the Gammorrean guard from Jabba's Prize, and now my Skiff looks  A LOT better. Why was this set out of production when Jabba's Palace introduced?  Worth getting just for han.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: where are the guards?
review:
Right from the start when I got this set I was getting it for what was inside. Now I relise it would have been way cooler if you got a Lando guard and another guard or two. I have jabbas palace so it works better with the palace.
It has only three downsides:
Lando Minfig missing?
No guards
Not big enough

Though all of the above is true it is great for a set and it is a really cool small set. Heck, forget what I said on other posts about my favourite small set I love em all.
Anyway I guess this set would also go well with a Sailbarge and another skiff (bigger) if lego would only make them, (And a sandcrawler too) As I have run out of peices.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice skiff
review: Well the skiff is nice, and is pretty much like it is in the movies, but the minifigs are a bit of a problem, well not the ones that are already there, but the ones that arent there. Were is Lando, Chewbacca, the other guards, and they could have added Boba Fett.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: A nice skiff to have!
review:
The desert skiff is a nice add to your collection. It would be much much more fun if the really big Jabba flagship was released. You get the Han Solo with a cool, plain outfit and the dark Luke (Dark Clothes)! I wish it came with a Lando Calrissian or one of Jabba's alien goons. The spiff is cool to be attacked and destroy, quite easy to break! You get two super minifigs but I think you can get enough Lukes elsewhere. This is a very nice set and has some nice pieces. Skiffs dont go that fast bu who knows, make it a starship! 
A bravo 8!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: good job, lego
review: this is a nice little skiff. It comes with Han Solo in his skiff outfit and luke skywalker. The only bad thing about it is that it should have came with a guard and lando calrissian, even though he wasnt released back the. Overall, this is a good set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Wheres the sarlacc?
review: I really don't like this set beacause they're missing people like boba fett, chewy, lando, and at least put one of jabbas gaurds. I also think they should have made the sarlacc pit (the big mouth in the middle of the desert with abunch of tentacles) Well I didn't like the set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: missed opportunity on some great figs, good set on it's own
review:
Let's get this right out in the open: don't expect to find a Skiff loaded with figs, like it was in the movies. Nope, we only get post-carbonite Han and Jedi Luke. Fear not, for including Boba Fett and the Gammorean Guard from Jabba's Prize already makes this Skiff a much better looking vehicle. Had Lego included these figs with the Skiff, it would have been more expensive, and people would be complaining about figures appearing one too many times and having a huge army of Lukes, Bobas and R2s. Lego could have included scene-specific figs to this set however, like Lando and some Weequays and other guards. They would have been exclusive to this set and therefore, Lego could have made a better set while still avoiding supplying tons of the same guy in all sets.
Han is nice, dressed in his plain white shirt and armed with a spear. I like his crooked smile, which is quite appropriate of Harrison Ford's character. I like Jedi Luke in this set much better than in Final Duel II, since the Jedi garb is appropriate for this scene, unlike the scene at Endor base, where Luke only wears the black jumpsuit without the Jedi vest over it. I like the fact both his hands are yellow, instead of having one black hand. Yes, he wears one black glove in RotJ, because he got shot in his robotic hand during this fight and the blast burned through the latex skin of his bionic hand, so he covered the hole with the glove. But he wears this glove after the whole Jabba sequence, since he doesn't have time during the fight to put it on. That's why this Luke has two yellow hands. nice attention to accuracy and detail, Lego! He comes with his green lightsaber as well.

Now onto the Skiff. I must keep reminding myself that this set is a little on the old side compared to the ep2 sets, so there is less detail and there are no printed pieces in the set. However, what's there is a quite accurate representation of the real Skiff and i like the fact it has a flat deck, which can fit a bunch of figs. It's on the small side however, so there won't be much that fits on it. I now have it displayed with the included Luke and Han, along with Boba and the Gammorean and it's already quite crowded. If Lego is ever gonna make the Sail Barge, this set will be much more appreciated that it is now.
it's got my respect, but that may have to do with the price I paid for him. I bought him with the Droid Starfighter on clearance at the local drug store together for only 11.40 euros(13.82 dollars) great deal, nice vehicle, good figures. can't go wrong.

May the Force be with You.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Desert Skiff
review:
This is a nice set for the price range, but personally I feel Lego could have done better by making it bigger and selling it for an extra AU$5-10. But still it captures the likeness of it's movie counterpart and was a good way to get Han in a cheap set. I find it funny that Luke has Obi-Wan's Phantom Menace head, but I'm not complaining since back when this set was released it was an easy way to make your own Obi-Wan without the hood if you never bought the Gungan Sub. 

Pros:
* Cheap way to get Han Solo and Obi-Wan's (Episode 1) head
* Captures the likeness for the price range it was sold

Cons:
* The set is a little too small

author: _add_um
title: CLASSIC LEGO STAR WARS
review:
This was my 1st ever Star Wars set, taken from return of the jedi. It includes Han Solo in his white shirt making him exclusive to the set (although different variations have been done since) and Luke Skywalker in his jedi outfit with two yellow hands instead of one black glove. Its a shame that there are no bad guys in it like Boba Fett or even a skiff guard. The skiff is nice and even has a plank for Luke to stand on although its too thin to put the minifig on properly it also has handle bars (that are sometimes used on lego bikes) as the controls of the skiff.

Pros:
* nice figs
* spear
* are brown pieces

Cons:
* the skiff itself is slightly undersized
* another minifig counld have been put in

Overall pretty enjoyble and is a nice set for its time and still remains as a classic star wars set.

author: brickbuster2409
title: kinda small
review: this set is awright but the skiff is undersized and there's not enough detail to make it comparable to the real skiff. i agree w/ A_McCartneyflax that there should have been more figures added to the set. also luke's head looks exactly like obi wan's (episode I version) and a guy like luke needs to have a unique appearance.  the platform, too, is to small for luke to jump of, unless he's on one leg.  this set is good but i wouldn't recommend it to star wars fans unless they want a cheap set.

author: rich_12
title: sweet like candy
review: i love this seth acept you should get a skiff lando a weequay and boba and chewie and they could have made it bigger but altogther a good set cause yu get luke in jedi fatigues and skiff han i got when i was five i think it's the best set ever acept you dun get boba chewi or landdo or a guard you should also get a sarlac pit but and way it's good cause it's sturdy and dosent fall apart eiasaly and ya it's an awsome set

author: Cloud2296
title: Dissapointment
review:
Horrible. You Cant even walk on the plank. No bikini leia, no jabba, no guard, no bib foruna, no droids, and the list gos on P's and C's

Pros: minifigs

Cons: everything else

Dont buy this. itll make you cry :*-(

author: Matt_Vader
title: Quite good set
review:
Good set bit small. Could be better with more minifigs (e.g. Lando, Chewie) 

PROS Doesn't break easily

CONS Can't actually walk the plank

Could be bigger

Could come with sarlac pit

I Recommed this set if you are a collecter

author: PepperPizzaMan2585
title: Good, but a little too small!
review: This little set is nice. It comes with a Luke Skywalker and a Han Solo figure with a spear, but I lost the spear somewhere. But I think its a little juniorized, and they could've included more figures like Lando and Desert Skiff guards. So I think that this set is nice, but could use some work.

author: general_veers
title: Needs more minifigs
review:
Its an ok set

Pros
Its one of the few Return of the jedi sets
Good playability

Cons
Looks bad
Needs more minifigs (Chewie, Lando, Gamorean Guard, Boba Fett)
The plank is to thin, so luke cant walk it

Minifigs
Han Solo- Has a stick
Luke- Has a green lightsaber

Get it if
You want the minifigs or if youre a collector

Dont get it if
You dont like the look of it, or you want more minifigs

Overall, a 5/10

author: starwarsgeek101_
title: Low Price! Two classic minifigs!
review: Here you've got Han and Luke trying to escape the pit where there about to be fed to. For $5.99 (VERY LOW PRICE), you can re-create the scene with the skiff. Sure it doesn't have any more fancy minifigs, but you've got two classics right here! This includes two weapons, Luke's green lightsaber, and a spear for Han.

author: donneyboy
title: needs more minifigs
review:
i got this for Christmas awhile ago and i loved it. it has luke with his lightsaber, and han with a spear.

pros-
small
inexpensive
one of a few return of the Jedi sets released

cons-
no chewy, boba fett, lando, not even a sarlacc
luke doesn't have fake hand
cant walk the plank.

author: Obi_Wan9994
title: Stop Complaining!
review:
I got this set a long time ago, and I honestly don't have as much against it as most people.

Pros: 
Luke mini fig
Han mini fig
some nice pieces
good playability
fast and easy to build

Cons:
too small
needs more mini figs

Honestly, for the price you're paying, you really don't deserve a bigger set with more mini figs, so my cons aren't exactly cons then. Still, this set isn't perfect, so it gets a 4/5.

author: vezon8764
title: "Throw them in!"
review:
This is a nice desert skiff, with Luke and Han with spear. Plank is kinda cool, and construction is nice, but it is a bit small and awkward.
Pros:
Luke and Han
Nice construction
Cockpit
Cons:
Plank sticks out and cannot be retracted
Nose cone is small
No bad guys.
Since there is no old fashioned Jabba's Sail Barge to go with this set, I give it a 3. I just think that this is thrown into the old Star Wars collection.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Desert Skiff Review
review:
This set is part of the movie "Star Wars - Episode VI - Return of the Jedi" when Han Solo and Luke Skywalker are supposed to be executed. This set comes with Han Solo who has a spear and Luke Skywalker who has his black jedi torso and his green lightsaber. Actually this lightsaber is translucent yellow but it looks like LEGO changed that in the 2011 summer sets. This speeder doesn't have many play features but it's very easy to maneuver this vehicle around. The ramp is a little bit too small for a minifig to walk around and we also don't get Jabba's guards, Chewbacca or Lando Calrissian who had been in this scene in this set.

I also love the design of the instructions where you get a picture of a scene from the Star Wars movies on each page. I think these instructions look much better than the ones we get in the Star Wars sets today. It's a good little set to have for little money.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

author: manny1134
title: Very First Lego Set
review: I absolutley love this set, mainly because it was my introduction to lego. It was either my first or second set (not really sure) and since then I've purchased a second on ebay and used it with Jabba's floating palace. I'm a big fan of the utter simplicity of this set, and the side rails, which were never used after this set, are nice rare pieces to have. I like how the old minifigs had yellow skin, which to me just makes them seem so much more lego like.

author: nizack05
title: Small but fun
review: There are no surprises with this set. As a star wars fan this is a great collector item. You get two great minifigures in Luke and Han (after being defrosted). This is a small set, but worth it if you are a collector.

author: Odeinoichus
title: I thought you were blind!
review:
Set #7104 Desert Skiff: Year two of LEGO Star Wars gave us many interesting new sets among them one from Return of the Jedi depicting a scene from close to the beginning of that film.

 

The titular Desert Skiff is admittedly an older take on this vehicle in LEGO form and does have a few minor problems. For one thing it is a tad on the smallish size and for another it only includes two Mini-Figures, but it is still an impressive and fun little set to build and play with. My only wish is that LEGO would have introduced the Double-Sided heads earlier on so they could have included a Han Squinting with eyes shut and a Han with eyes open head for this set. (Have they even gone and done that yet???)

 

Building it doesn't take too long, and as I said before the vehicle is still amusing to play with or just add to the Great Pit of Carkoon Display on your LEGO Star Wars shelves. The Mini-Figures are nice too and include Luke as a Jedi Knight without glove and Han Solo, back in the day he was a rare figure to come by. In fact this plus the Han from Echo Base and the Han in Carbonite (Technically) are the only three LEGO Han's I own because of that fact. He looks nice too even with the yellow face, his brown pants and open white shirt are nice pieces.

 

Overall I'd recommend this set to anyone who's looking for more pieces to build up a truly impressive Great Pit of Carkoon display, as a bonus you'll have another chromed Lightsaber hilt as opposed to the flat grey tone LEGO has stuck with for the past number of years and for some reason Han is holding a coveted Black Spear. If you can find it at a good price don't hesitate to snap it up. The rare brown elements in the set alone which make up the sides of the skiff are worth the cost of investment.

author: bricksnapper52
title: Lower Your Expectations, Raise the Rating:)
review:
Many of the complaints about this set center around the small size and failure to stay true to the real desert skiff from the movie.  One of the main reasons why I love Lego is that they typically do a great job recreating things with amazing accuracy.  This set does fail miserably in that category and that is why I rate it a 4 out of 5.  The rating would probably fall a bit lower, but the skiff is still cool and does provide room for 2 or 3 minifigs.  It is also an insanely good value! I got this set for a very cheap price off of eBay, right around the original price of $6 USD.  That price for 2 minifigs and a pretty neat little vehicle (I hesitate to call it call it the Desert Skiff) is what keeps my interest high. 

 

Pros

 - Great value!

 - 2 Minifigs and my favorite green lightsaber

 - Cool design

 

Cons

 - Inaccuracy to the real Desert Skiff

 

I wish lego had made this a $25 set and made the real Desert Skiff complete with the Skiff Guard and Lando. But, overall if you can find this cheap, I recommend it!  But don't pay a huge discontinued set premium for it; you will be underwhelmed.

author: ZeldaTheSwordsman
title: Good Desert Skiff for the time - and price.
review:
My dad got this for me back in 2000; I was a very happy boy that day. The battle at the Great Pit of Carkoon was one of my favorite Star Wars scenes, and so having a set of one of the skiffs (That included a Return of the Jedi Luke to boot!) was a delight.

The skiff is very simple, as in the movie. The colors never looked off to me; still don't. The pieces used do a very good job capturing the shape, although it's a bit small (Though granted, four-stud-wide one-seater cars were still the standard at this time). Making it six studs wide would have given more standing room, but I understand why they didn't; the slope pieces necessary to do the nose at that width didn't exist yet. The boat/space windshield piece used was a clever touch; it captures, in angularized form, the nose of the skiff without cutting down on standing room (which was already at a premium) very much. I have unfortunately lost this piece on mine, and the crude substitution I had to make is no match. The gang-plank, a 1x8 tile, is a bit narrow and tricky to get a minifigure to stand on, but it's in proportion to the rest of the set, and it being a tile makes it easier for Luke to hang onto. The tan 2x2 round bricks on the bottom serve two purposes: Giving the appearance of hovering over a sandy surface, and serving as the magnetic lifters that picked up R2 and 3PO (Though a Technic axle-pin hybrid or 1x1 pin would be needed for 3PO).

As for the figures.. We only get two, but that's good for the price. Including Lando as well would have been nice, but he was still in minifigure limbo at the time (LEGO was hesitant about moving to using flesh tones, but at the same time didn't want to end up being racist by making a Lando with the same "Skin tone" as everyone else). We get Luke, now using the same face as the Episode 1 Obi-Wan figures to represent his ROTJ serious face, and in his black Jedi tunic and pants. His hands are both yellow, but that's actually accurate given when in the movie this set takes place. The synth-flesh on his prosthetic wasn't damaged until partway through this battle, and he didn't pull a glove over it until after taking off for Dagobah in his X-Wing. He is armed with his awesome green lightsaber, ready to slice his way through Jabba's thugs. This was the only set to have him at the time. Also included is Han Solo, sans vest (as per the movie) and armed with a black spear, which LEGO felt fit the proportions of the vibro-axes in the movie better than their poleaxe piece. Chewbacca was still exclusive to 7190 Millennium Falcon at the time of this set's release, so I don't mind him not being in it. Skiff guards would have been good, but that's asking a bit much of the price. There may have been a Sail Barge set being designed at the time that got scrapped later; I don't know.

Overall, a very nice set to have. Would I recommend getting? Yes, if you want an old-style ROTJ Luke and can find it for close to the original MSRP. Certainly I wouldn't recommend paying $30 like I've seen some eBay listings priced for.
